about.description:
Computer Vision Engineer and Data Scientist specialized in image processing, remote sensing, astroinformatics, and optical payload simulation. I lead the Payload Department of the IGNIS CubeSat Project, focusing on radiometric modeling, MTF/SNR analysis, and optical system simulation in Zemax.
Proficient in Python, OpenCV, TensorFlow, and PyTorch. I combine physics-based modeling, deep learning, and astroinformatics methods to build reliable imaging systems for aerospace and Earth observation missions.

items.title: IGNIS CubeSat Project
bulletPoints: Designed and implemented radiometric and optical simulations for FLIR Boson 640 thermal camera (6° & 8° lens).
Developed Python tools for SNR/MTF analysis, heat-map generation, and altitude scaling.
Simulated camera performance in Zemax OpticStudio, including spot diagrams and resolution analysis.
Integrated Payload modeling with Mission Analysis and ADCS parameters for orbital geometry.
Led a small technical team, coordinated deliverables, and produced detailed engineering reports.
Supported early mission design by providing camera performance predictions under different orbital scenarios.

items.title: Morphological Classification of Extragalactic Radio Sources
bulletPoints: Built and trained a CNN model to classify radio galaxies into FR0, FRI, and FRII classes.
Processed and balanced a dataset of 18,000+ images to ensure stable training and evaluation.
Performed data augmentation and symmetry-based feature engineering to improve model performance.
Conducted extensive EDA, visualization, and error analysis to refine classification accuracy.
Integrated additional morphological features into the network after CNN feature extraction.
Documented results and structured the project for scalability and reproducibility.

items.title: ALS Clinical Data Modeling
bulletPoints: Analyzed longitudinal clinical data from 254 ALS patients (1,412 visits) collected at the ALS Center of Federico II University Hospital.
Explored demographic, clinical, and progression variables (ALSFRS-R, KINGS stage, MRC scores, FVC, therapy, diagnostic delay, etc.).
Modeled disease severity and progression using GLM, ordinal regression, and mixed-effects models.
Incorporated Bayesian posterior analysis to estimate parameter uncertainty and interpret clinical variable effects.
Compared cross-sectional vs. longitudinal strategies to handle repeated measures per patient.
Applied feature engineering, missing data treatment, and variable transformation to improve model robustness.
Delivered a scientific report, codebase, and presentation structured like a research article.

items.title: EZ-Tech
bulletPoints: Recovered and reconstructed data from damaged or corrupted storage devices (HDD, SSD, RAID, flash memory).
Diagnosed hardware and software failures using specialized forensic tools.
Developed and optimized recovery workflows to increase success rate and reduce turnaround time.
Provided technical support and consultation to clients for secure data handling.
Collaborated with cross-functional teams to ensure service quality and data confidentiality.
